title: And in other news...
body: The April calendar is online, as is MoxieTV episode 3. Enjoy! I'm still pounding out the print version of the calendar, and hope to send it off to the printer later today. It's going to be another great month!
author: Dan

comments.author: Fyse
comments.body: Moxie TV just keeps getting better. AWESOME stuff guys.

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: Thanks Fyse!

comments.author: Caleb
comments.body: GENIUS! That was great guys.

comments.author: Nate
comments.body: Am I picking up on a Lost-ish black/white theme in clothing?

comments.author: Nate
comments.body: I'm going to watch that again and look for hidden clues.  Maybe if we zoon in on Nicole's laptop we will see the numbers.

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: Please don't zoon on Nicole's laptop... I just had it cleaned!

comments.author: cassandra
comments.body: yeah for another great month.....

comments.author: Greg Kinnear
comments.body: What do you mean I am just "uh...Greg Kinnear?!" I owned that movie and all your customers would say so if Pierce Brosnan wasn't paying them all a hundred dollars for their flamboyant assertations of his muted, melodramatic performance. You know it Dan, you know it.

comments.author: Whimsy Chick
comments.body: LOVE MoxieTV and can't wait for the Podcast version. :)

comments.author: The Four Finger Soc Em
comments.body:
Hey, I don't know if this was some kind of "find the error" game that you guys put in or something, but when you were typing in the numbers (which are: 4 8 15 16 23 42), you typed 4 8 16 16...
So, I either just ruined Dan's day by pointing out a mistake and showed what a huge nerd I am, or I just made a lot of people angry and showed what a huge nerd I am.

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: The LOST numbers aren't the same as The Moxie numbers. I entered the LOST numbers once.... the coupler busted as a result.

comments.author: brian of moore
comments.body:
woah.. somehow i missed episode two
so far that ranks at the best episode
... i replayed the 'more people dance' 4 times
hilarious....  and the kicker was the ding of the frong door at the end

and of course any episode with bjork in it.. gets extra points

did everyone else already say this last week?
sorry... ill try harder next time

comments.author: justin
comments.body:
those shots of the numbers were ripped directly out of a real episode of Lost. Specifically, episode 14 of season 2. 

Thanks for the nice comments everyone!

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: And by "those shots of the numbers were ripped directly out of a real episode of Lost. Specifically, episode 14 of season 2." Justin really means: "Don't ever question my artistic integrity!!!!11"

comments.author: Nate
comments.body:
Kenny really made True/False sound like a fun time, what with everyone rushing to get something to eat all at once and talking about what they just saw.

Dan, did I see ass-crack near the end there?  I believe frame by frame might reveal some ass-crack, but I've no desire to check.

Justin, awesome job.  Again.

Honestly though I think you could do Lost spoofs from here till forever and I'd be happy.

comments.author: Nate
comments.body: It would have been nice had you let the Lost music continue on into (what I think of as) the "piano theme", giving the image of Dan scrubbing the bathroom floors a nice melancholy feel.

comments.author: The Four Finger Soc Em
comments.body: Ha, sorry Justin. Then it must have been the episode where a frantic John Locke hurriedly types in the numbers as the clock is counting down into the single didgits.  See, he messes up and has to backspace, then retype them, which, of course, generates extra suspense.

comments.author: Nate
comments.body:
It cuts out right at 1:53, if you're curious.

What?  I'm a big nerd?

comments.author: Caleb
comments.body: So can we expect a Moxie "lockdown" anytime soon, similar to the one in the previews for tomorrow night's episode? If there was one place that I could pick to get trapped in by huge steel doors slamming down at every exit, it would be the Moxie.

comments.author: Caleb
comments.body: I'm sorry Nicole and Kelley but you two own episode 3. I keep watching the part where Nicole is explaining what's going on. Kelley sounds like a ditz who could care less and Nicole sounds like a robot being forced to be there against her will. It's hysterical. And also provides interesting insight into their character's role on the island...I mean in the theater.

comments.author: Matthew Martin (Master RJ)
comments.body: Are you really closed on April 18th (Eric Roberts' birthday) or is this a joke? And while you're at it, observe December 12th as well.

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: RJ: let me get this straight... are you admitting to NOT observing Eric Roberts Day? I thought it was a national holiday. It's no joke. We'll be closed on that day.

comments.author: evilvet
comments.body:
Didn't you already try the Dave Chappelle block party thing?  If memory serves me...

/post/315

comments.author: Chris L.
comments.body:
MoxieTV is kicks unholy @$$. Started reading the blog late last week, and you guys are my new heroes. Bet you didn't know you had Moxie fans in New Mexico, did you? (OK, so I lived my entire life in KC until two years ago...)

Found the blog because I've wanted to do exactly what you guys have done for a few years now.  I shouldn't admit that the first time I thought about (re)opening a theater, it was in Rolla. Did I not mention I lived there for a year and a half, too? I must've blocked it. I'm seeing a therapist.

...the image of Dan scrubbing the bathroom floors a nice melancholy feel

Which reminds me. You should call your series of articles Cinemelancholy: The Rise and Fall of the Movie Industry

comments.author: Chris L.
comments.body:
Oh, I thought we could use HTML tags... Part of that was bolded and part was in italics. The third paragraph is a quote from an earlier comment.

Should I use "i" and "b" instead of "em" and "strong"?

comments.author: The Four Finger Soc Em
comments.body: I can't get it to work. After Dan, in the bathroom, says "the food was wonderful" (whoa, that sounds really weird) it cuts out. This is like the tenth time I've tried it. I've tried each kind of video, I've waited for streaming. I even downloaded it, and every time at the 1:01 mark it stops. At that point on the downloaded version, it stops and says "this file is corrupted". Nothing seems to work.

comments.author: justin
comments.body: weird.  what OS/browser are you using?

comments.author: Derek
comments.body:
Hey, that's me!

:-)

comments.author: The Four Finger Soc Em
comments.body: I might be the last living person using AOL. Last living person? Hmm, not quite sure if dead people browse the internet... oh wait, of course they do, PULSE.

comments.author: Chris L.
comments.body: When there is no more room in AOL, the dead will browse the internet.
